sentences.sContent: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.sCn: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

sentences.sContent: ...The great majority of smartphone users don' t take the trouble to adjust their settings to suit their own purposes...
...The merging of diverse peoples into a common mass has produced tension among members of the minorities and the majority alike...
...and European countries are essentially climate "free-riders": causing the majority of the problems through high greenhouse gas emissions...
...and the majority of working professionals spend additional hours checking in with work during evenings...
...the majority of which are African or small island states...
...The overwhelming majority of employees attribute their stress mainly to low pay and an excessive workload...
...America lacked the incentive to care for the majority of its citizens as it found no rival for its economic model...
...adding that a majority of first-generation undergraduates tend toward options such as online programs...
...Some version of the Swedish system might work well for a majority of American parents...
...unlike the vast majority of principals around the world...
...the majority of those who enter the labor market will be required to obtain a college degree in the future...
...And at the vast majority of places...
...In it the majority of students will have conformed to the standard model of the time: male...
...that guy won't be able to win the election unless he gets some majority vote from women students...
...Karsten Hank of Mannheim University found that 85% of them lived within 25km of each other and the majority of them were in touch at least once a week...
...especially for those born and bred in cities --- their joys are dimmed and even lost because a majority of them are forced to attend various art classes...

phrases.pCn: 过半数；一般多数， 简单多数
沉默的大多数（持温和观点并很少发表意见者）

words.tran: 主要的；重要的；主修的；较多的
[人类] 成年人；主修科目；陆军少校

trans.tranOther: most of the people or things in a group
